I just can't help but feel that an experts opinion even on art is more important than an average consumers opinion. Your thoughts?

q.q: today my priest told an anecdote in his sermon about how when he was a youth pastor he would make the youth play "mixer games" and one of them was where he would give an either/or option like "Batman or Superman" and each option had a side of the room, so (i guess, although it's left a little ambiguous:) whichever side you were "for" or "liked more," you'd go to that side. and I was immediately like: that's bullshit. chocolate or vanilla? well, first of all, it depends entirely on the application. i usually like chocolate ice cream and cake but i often like vanilla cake with vanilla frosting. but that doesn't even scratch the surface of all possible or even probable dessert options that could include chocolate or vanilla. this is assuming we're talking about Desserts That I Would Like To Eat Right Now and not, say, Desserts I Would Give My Enemy (i'd give him whichever he liked least in that application), or Paint Colors For My Bathroom, which given  such a restricted choice I guess I'd have to go with vanilla. but like, what kind of fascist horseshit government am i living under that only allows brown and off-white (or maybe black, if you're talking about the actual color of a vanilla bean) as bathroom colors? after going through the other three examples of random dichotomies he gave my mind started itching from the inside and i realized that ten minutes had gone by and i'd missed half of an interesting sermon on predestination, which most people think is when God takes people's souls before they're born and puts them on either the Heaven side of the room or the Hell side of the room. (but i think his point was that it's not really like that.) and i didnt even think about "bill wurtz" until i was conscious of the brain itch but when i was i just smiled a little bit and thought i'd tell you about it.

q.a: the downbeat usually means any of the 4 quarter notes (in 4/4 for example). the upbeat is the in between 8th note. the 2 and 4 can be called the 'backbeat' if there is a snare, clap, etc happening there. 1 and 3 would be the 'white beat' because that's when all the white people clap. god bless, they're trying their hardest

q.a: i think exact rhyming is kind of a myth, especially in music. not necessary, and sometimes not even the best choice. for 'love', 'of' is probably my best 'exact' choice, 'enough' is equally strong, then if we think outside the box a little, try 'one', 'none', 'done', ... i think if you try words with that sound as a rhyme for 'love', i think it will sound just fine. especially if you are making sure that the lines are something you want to say, not just something to try to force a rhyme. in music, as long as the vowel sound is the same, that's really all that matters. i actually think it often sounds better when the consonant sound at the end is a little different. it's kind of like when the daily speical is a little different than it was yesterday
q.q:

but it's weird using that if the rhyming scheme comes at the end of the phrase.

q.a: it's a classic situation for focused and hardworking artists (or any career) to find themselves in a relationship where the other person realizes that the artist needs to make their work the #1 priority. it is a very common story, but not the end of the world. it just means those types of relationships won't work. this is very very common, and it is also common for hardworking and focused artists to find relationships that work. usually when the other person has equally strong passions of their own, maybe different, maybe even the same one. i've seen this work plenty of times. but the failed relationship you're talking about is a classic story, and very common among people in your situation. i've been in one of those relationships as well. it's no big deal, you just learn why it doesn't work, and you both move on

q.a: a good starting point to understanding sus chords is: play a C major triad (C, E, G). ok now play it with F note instead of E: (C, F, G). that is called Csus4. ok now play Csus4, then C. nice! Ok now also there is a rumor going around that if you use 2 instead of 4 (C,D,G) that is called Csus2, but that one doesn't really take as much pleaseure in the resolve as the Csus4 to C resolve. but it's still easier to say Csus2 than to say Cadd2no3. even quicker to just say C2, which is what i usually say. also you may have noticed that Csus4 can be the same as Fsus2, depending on whether the bass player is playing C or F. i'm not sure if that answers your question.

q.a: since it's already odd and doesn't have 5,  check for 3. the check for 3 is if the digits add up to another multiple of 3. you can also do this by knocking off all multiples of 3 you see in the digits, even if it's multiple digits next to each other. so delete the 9s, delete the 3, and delete the "42". and you're left with 2 which is not a multiple of 3 so we've ruled out 3. Now you just start moving through the prime numbers, checking each one. there are many different tricks here, but it's generally the same strategies for every other prime from now on. let's say we're checking for 7 (the next prime to check for). see the 23, on the left? that's close to 21, so let's change that to 2.  == 29429. what this means is, we just subtracted 210000 from the original number. so what this means is, if the original number is a multiple of 7, then 2949 has to be a multiple of 7 also because we just subtracted 210000 (which is clearly a multiple of 7).  basically we manipulate the original number by multiples of 7, until it is simple enough to see whether the resulting number is a multiple of 7. and if it is, congratulations the original number was a multiple of 7 also. in the manipulations, you are allowed to add or subtract any multiple of 7, and you can also multiply or divide by anything you want. so from 29429, i can see "42" in there, so you can just replace that with zero 29009 (we just subtracted 420, which of course is a multiple of 7).  now let's add 21 == 29030, knock off the zero at the end (you can divide this by 10 and it won't effect whether or not it's a mutiple of 7, so you can knock off zeros on the end all you want.) so 2903. now let's add 7 == 2910, knock off the zero = 291.  (you can see the strategy, we're adding/subtracting small multiples of 7 based on whatever can even off the end to have a zero at the end, because then we can kill the zero and the number shrinks and still has its same status with regard to being a multiple of 7 or not.)  so from 291, take off 21 is 270, knock off the zero is 27. which is clearly NOT a multiple of 7. basically i'm adding and subtracting multiples of seven to get the number simpler and simpler until eventually we can tell if the resulting number is a multiple of 7.   and if you couldn't see whether 27 was a multiple of 7 then you could just knock off the 7 and it's 20, knock off the zero is 2. which is not a multple of 7. So congratulations, the original number (239429) is not a multiple of 7. Next we check for 11s. i would start with the left again, because 23 is so close to 22. replace it with 1 == 19429. then add 11 to the right,(and kill the zero) 1944. you can knock off 44, and pow, 19, not 11. so 11 is ruled out. Then start again for 13.  from the left, change the 23 to 10 (effectively subtracting 130000), == 109429. '109' is 5 above 104 which i happen to know has 13 in it, so replace 109 with 5. == 5429.  54 is 2 above 52, which i happen to know has 13 in it, so 229. what's the nearest multiple of 13 above 229? 260. is that a multiple of 13 away? can't be because the only one in that century with 1 at the end of it is 91 and it's not 91 away (it's 31 away, again non-13.) so 13 is out. now check for 17. repeat this process through the primes, 17, 19, 23, 29, 31, etc etc.  and you may be wondering "how far do i have to go before knowing if the original number is prime." well the answer is, if you are checking them all in order and you do it correctly, the process is guaranteed complete once you reach the square root of the original number. the way to loosely figure that out is, look at 250000. square root of that should be 5 with zeros ...500 times 500 should be 250000. so in this case if you check all the primes up to 500 and you don't find a match then you know you can stop. but if you find a match at let's say 31, then you divide the thing by 31 and then you have a much smaller number to work with, and find the primes there. then when you're done just include 31 as well. by the way i didn't check 31 in this example so 31 probably is not in there

q.q: Regarding the 7.19.17 6:32AM question about what defines a chord... you can give a group of notes many different names, the main thing is to look at the context. What chord comes before it, what comes after? What notes are the other instruments/singer playing at the same time you're playing your chord (the bass player has the power to change a lot of chords if he/she wants to and the "melody instrument" can add extensions). It doesn't really matter what name you give the chord, but if you're writing a piece of sheet music or something.. I'd give it the name that I think makes the most sense in the full context of the song.

q.a: ah, welcome to the waterfall. after enjoying that free-falling feeling of helplessly falling into the abyss for quite a while, suddenly you will remember that with a little organization, you can easily separate this into 2 distinct job titles. one where you just write down and log the new ideas as they occur, like a bolt of lightening, try to get down as much as you can in the moment, (this may happen anywhere! at the mall, at the zoo, remember to keep small tools on hand to be able to catch these ideas at any time. in todays day in age i recommend a smart phone, etc). And then, at another time, in another suit, at another desk, as a different employee, you will get down to work in a nice, quiet place. Which idea the 'worker' chooses to work on will have nothing to do with which idea was created first, or last, or anything else. There will need to be another decision system that chooses which idea to do when. and i don't know what the best way is, that is something you will have to manage within the company as a whole. but if all else fails, computer aided random number selection does work. So actually there is 3 job titles. the dreamer (idea creator) the worker (who works on the idea) and the manager, who SOMEHOW has to decide what idea to work on. i think it is very important that the worker and the manager do not play the same role at the same time-- the worker needs to never question the authority of the decision to work on the project at hand, or else they will not be able to focus on making that project the best it can be. the manager needs to make that decision, and then tell the worker what the project is.
q.q: i get sick of ideas i have and i no longer want to work on them just a few days after i start working on them. they're good ideas but i have more ideas and they're more fun to think about. but i still want those original ideas made?

q.a: i just call it a 'quiet verse.' i've never found a better name for it. it specifically means the verse that occurs nearing the end of the song, after at least 2 choruses have happened and usually after the bridge if there is one. the dynamic drops low, it mimics the verse, and very often jumps back up to a high dynamic to usher into the last chorus(s). very standard technique. in this case we've used a half-length-verse, and also a half-length pre-chorus.
q.q: how would you call that section in "got to know what's going on" right before the last choruses? the bit that goes "open the door, cuz i got to know what we came here for, whatever it is i'll believe it". it doesn't "feel" like part of the bridge since it imitates the verse, chorus and prechorus sections. my best guess would be to call it a "summary" but that's not a musical term afaik

q.a: i'm losing my mind over merch. i hated it, i never wanted to do it. i don't want to do it. so forgive me if i am every which way on finding a strategy. the only reason i am considering it is because i found a company that wants to do merch with me and they have the capability of doing take-downs on illegal merch. like when someone else sells billwurtz shirts and makes money off it, the company i'm working with can take those down. i wish i could just do take downs, and not make any merch. i really don't like merch, it makes me sad for some reason. but people told me they are being targetted with ads from redbubble selling my merch, so in other words people are making billwurtz stuff and making money off it, AND they are targetting my fans to buy it. like i said, i wish i could just do take downs, but no one is ever gonna agree to help me do take downs if we can't sell our own stuff instead. right now i'm designing it myself, but it is time taken away from doing videos etc. it's the worst. and any moment i could snap out of it and change my mind and go back to 'no merch.' i made a steve shirt, and i know people are asking for those, but that just seems gross for me, especially in a few weeks, to see a steve shirt, especially if i don't get a chance to make a broad library of merch, just to have that one shirt? terrible. i can't stand it. so it's very weird and i don't want to be spending time on this. but i'm scared to let other people design stuff because then i'm going to have a million people sending me things and let's say one of their ideas is very simple, or what if 2 people have the same idea, and then it gets used, people are going to be upset that they think i'm stealing their ideas. so i really don't know what to do, although right now i am using a randomize strategy where i pick a random video and make something out of it, but if you have any specific requests i would love to hear them. maybe there is a certain thing you would want that i might not have thought of. this is a very confusing issue and i'm sorry

q.a: "filing for an extension on my taxes" i thought was a nice line for that point in the video because it was a nice contrast to the much simpler items that come before it (drive a car, in a tree, what's your name, that type of stuff.) it was fun to jump to something much more 'grownup' and verbose. but the line also has a twist at the end because he says he's never going to pay the taxes. which i thought was a fun idea because if he's not going to pay them, then why is he filing for an extention, right

Analysis:


Part 1: play by play

The video opens up with our protagonist "Steve" introducing himself. The very next thing he tells us is that he drives a car thats stuck in a tree. He then goes on to admit he was lying and that his real name isn't steve. he then says that he's filing for an extension on his taxes because he didn't pay them but in the same sentence says doesn't plan to do them. Why? Because "thats the way he likes to live his life and he feels like everything's gonna be fine". The day ends. The next day he tells the viewer that hes skipping work again, implying he does it frequently, but clarifies that its because hes unemployed. The mailman delivers mail but he adds the details that he was late and wa s actual ly a woman. She then breaks into the same jingle steve did earlier saying "thats the way i like to live my life..." . All of a sudden theres a change of scenery and he starts talking about mountains that we can see are right behind his house yet he says "I don't remember why i first saw the mountains". He then says that they've ALWAYS been there. He wonders why they're there but whether he knows or not he has to accept that they're there. He says that he can't claim them. Then he does a complete 180 and states that he can and does so very quickly. He then starts the jingle from before. "Thats the way i like to live my life.." but he gets cut off right as he starts, its another mail delivery. This time the person delivering it is a bird but he doesn't mention anything about it nor does he mention anything about the mail being delivered straight to him rather then to his house. The mailman doesn't break into a jingle this time, only saying "heres the mail." The letter is adres sed to s teve despite that not being his name, which he points out, and it asks how he climbed the mountain. Steve says he glad the person asked and gives a simple answer saying that its a simple two step process, first find the mountain, then climb it. After this steve breaks into the last jingle of the video but this time he says "Thats the way we can get things done and thats how I do it, its easy and simple cause you know what to do." Steve stands there smiling when a downpour starts but steve doesn't react at all simply standing there and smiling. A 5 day weather forecast pops up on screen showing nothing but rain for each day and it moves rapidly showing rain for many more days then 5. Steve then says "bye i'm steve" despite saying it wasn't his name earlier and the screen cuts to black.


Part 2: Breakdown of Steve

This is obviously a very confusing story. The main character "steve" makes many contradictory and strange statements and bizarre things ha ppen wit h no explanation. To fully understand this we need to look at the story part by part then look at the big picture. First of all why does steve introduce himself as steve and then say thats not actually his name? The character steve seems to represent many things throughout the story, at times he operates the same as any normal person, or character in a story might but at other times he does very strange things. He changes his identity and says things that are impossible such as him driving a car in a tree, theres also a point where a talking bird delivers him mail. Steve doesn't pay taxes and doesn't have a job, He's also secluded from others in the mountains. These traits are indicative of multiple personality disorder and schizophrenia. The viewer isn't a character in the story but he talks to the viewer, rather then just narrating whats happening I think steve is talking to himself and the viewer is seeing whats happening through his eyes, this is why we saw the bird talk ing. The first real thing does in the story is file for an extension on his tax returns and then say he wont ever be paying them. Although this statement may seem like he doesn't plan to pay what he owes, I think whats actually happening is steve doesn't owe anything at all. Steve doesn't appear to live in a city but rather a rural area with mountains so it may be either he is excused from paying taxes because of his mental ailments or the government of his country doesn't require its citizens to pay taxes.


Part 3: breakdown of events

First, Either way the point of him filing for an extension is pointless,

q.a: i've used it for different things, and it works differently depending on what i'm using it for. but the main reason i use it is to help make decisions when i know that any decision would be right. one of the most important things i've learned is you can really make something out of anything. this is one of the most important things that i've realized, and it applies to songwriting, making videos, anything. and it's great news to realize this, but if you are also responsible for choosing what thing to do, it often undermines your confidence. think of it this way: the great news is you can make any piece of trash into something great. sounds exciting, right? but what if you're allowed to choose which piece of trash to use? you won't be able to think clearly. because part of the reason it works is because you know you have to be stuck with that thing, and you have to figure out how to make it good. if you're allowed to choose what thing to start with then you're just going to constantly question if you're working on the right thing and you're going to get cold feet on every project immediately because you're not sure if it's the right project, and you won't have any brain power left to actually figure out what to do on the project because you will be busy second guessing whether it's the right project. so that's why it helps to get all your choices into a list and make a firm plan to do whatever project is decided by the randomizer. one of the main places i've used this is when picking what songs to record. i've written hundreds of songs throughout the years, and there are so many left to be recorded. so usually when i put out a song i pick from this list. every song has tiny reasons why i think "oh that's the wrong song for right now" but if you have that attitude you're never going to be comfortable picking a song. i always try to 'actually choose the right one' but my confidence in the decision collapses every time, and i have to randomize. as a result i have recorded some songs that i probably never would have chosen otherwise, but i was able to make them into something good because i wasn't questioning the entire decision while trying to make the thing. i think a lot of artists use randomization in various ways when they feel there are too many choices. i also often get a random word suggestion as a starting point for writing tweets

q.a: my vine audience was hooked on daily videos, when i actually had only been making 2 a week. this was possible because when i first started getting popular on vine around may 2015, i still had about 100 videos made that hadn't yet been posted on the vine channel. so throughout may, june, july, all i had to do was convert 1 video per day into vine format, and post it. i was only making 2 new ones per week, but i was converting 7 old ones per week and posting them to vine. because i was posting them faster than i was making them, it was inevitable that i would run out in august. so i had to make a decision on whether to continue making 2 a week and drastically reduce the vine upload schedule to 2 a week, or start actually making 7 new ones per week. i decided to do a lot of jingle based videos, and i started by singing about the situation at hand
